Summary: This document contains the timetable for the Master of Technology in Enterprise Business Analytics program for the January 2022 part-time intake. The course will run from July to November 2023 and will include courses such as Text Processing Using Machine Learning, Conversational Uls, and New Media and Sentiment Mining. The courses will be taught by lecturers Aobo and Zhenzhen, and will take place on Saturdays from 9:00am to 5:00pm at the Innovation I & II (L3) and Blue Ocean (L4) venues. The timetable is subject to change and was last updated on September 11, 2023.

This page contains the timetable for the BA09 PT Student course for the academic year 2023/2024. The course is focused on Analytics Commercial Excellence and will cover topics such as specialized predictive modelling and forecasting, complex predictive modelling and forecasting, and product and pricing analytics. The course will be taught by lecturers Brandon, Christine, Jen Hong, Dave, and Rita at the Momentum (L4) venue on Saturdays from 9:00am to 5:00pm. The course will run from 1 July 2023 to 30 September 2023, with a break on 9 September 2023. This timetable is subject to change and was last updated on 11 September 2023.

The document outlines the timetable for the BA09 PT student course for the academic year 2023/2024. The course will be taught by various lecturers and will cover topics such as Explainable and Responsible AI for Finance, Advanced Machine Learning for Financial Services, Alternative Data for Fintech Innovation, Credit Risk Modelling and Analytics, and MTech EBAC. The classes will take place on Saturdays from 9:00am to 5:00pm at different venues, including Ambition I & II, Blue Ocean, Momentum, Pinnacle, Integrity, and Horizon. The timetable is subject to change and was last updated on 11/9/2023.

The AY2023/2024 Semester 1 Exam Timetable lists the exam dates and times for various graduate certificate courses, including Analytics Project Management, Intelligent Reasoning Systems, Architecting Smart Systems, Business Analytics Practice, Pattern Recognition Systems, Engineering Big Data, Practical Language Processing, Architecting Scalable Systems, Specialized Predictive Modelling and Forecasting, Intelligent Robotic Systems, Intelligent Financial Risk Management, Big Data Analytics, Intelligent Software Agents, Customer Analytics, Intelligent Sensing Systems, and Securing Ubiquitous Systems.
